Workshop on Koryo Medicine Opens in Peru
articles.content:
Workshop on Koryo Medicine Opens in Peru 
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of a workshop on Koryo medicine was held in Lima, Peru, on June 23.
 The chairman of the San Miguel District Council of Lima said at the ceremony that the DPRK has long paid great attention to developing the traditional Koryo medicine for the promotion of people's health. He hoped that Peruvian medical persons and students would work hard to study the Korean traditional Koryo medicine.    
 The participants in the ceremony looked round photos showing the progress made in the DPRK and its people's happy life.

articles.content:
S. Korea-Japan Joint Naval Maneuver Denounced 
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- 50 civic and social organizations including the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration, the Council for National Reconciliation and Independent Reunification and the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils reportedly released a joint statement titled "We denounce the south Korea-Japan joint naval maneuver" on July 7.
 Noting that the coastal police office of south Korea and the Japan Coast Guard staged a "joint naval maneuver" under the pretext of "combating terrorism" from July 7, the statement said that the U.S. has justified its wars of aggression under the signboard of "anti-terrorism." It termed the on-going exercise part of such "anti-terrorism war".   
 The "anti-terrorism war" rather makes the world more uneasy, the statement said, demanding the south Korean authorities immediately halt the joint exercise.

Greetings to Mongolian President
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Mongolian President Nambariin Enkhbayar on the occasion of the 84th anniversary of the victory in the Mongolian people's revolution, the national holiday of the Mongolian people.
 The message sincerely wished the president and the people of Mongolia bigger success in their efforts for the prosperity and the progress of the country and expressed conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and develop in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.content:
Greetings to Mongolian PM and FM
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greetings to Mongolian Prime Minister Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorzh on the occasion of the 84th anniversary of the victory in the Mongolian people's revolution, their national holiday. 
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too, the message sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work for maintaining the nation's economic growth and improving the material and cultural living standard of the people.    
 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Mongolian counterpart Tsendin Mungkh-Orgil.

articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the delegation of the Communist Party of China now on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by the head of the delegation Xi Jinping, member of the Central Committee of the CPC who is also secretary of the Zhejiang Provincial Committee of the CPC, on Sunday.

Delegation of European Parliament Here
    Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the European Parliament headed by Ursula Stenzel, chairperson of the Sub-Committee for the Korean Peninsula of the parliament, arrived here today.
 It was greeted at the airport by Ri Jong Hyok, deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and chairman of the Korea-West European Friendship Parliamentary Group, officials concerned and Swedish Ambassador to the DPRK Paul Beijer and British Charge d'Affaires in Pyongyang Lindsay Stent.
